page.title: 01Preston St Mary & Environs
page.content: This is an agricultural landscape softened by woods and streams.There are 10 farms in area.Mainly arable, but also dairy, pig sheep and fowls. Crop grown. Wheat barley oats, rape potatoes, sugar beet, sweet corn, evening primrose, apples and rye grass.A mixed population of about 200. The real Suffolk people whose families have lived here for generations,work on the land or as bricklayers, carpenters, thatchers. Young professional families, doctors, solicitors, who have made their houses here, commute to neighbouring towns to work. The retired people in their 'Dream Cottages, gardening enjoying the countryside and contributing to community by serving Parish Council or the church. Children are 'bussed ' to school in Lavenham, but the old school is used nightly for clubs and
